Title: SWFTools: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A heap-based buffer overflow in SWFTools could result in the
    execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: SWFTools is a collection of SWF manipulation and generation utilities written by Rainer BÃ¶hme and Matthias Kramm.

Description.Text: Integer overflow errors in the "getPNG()" function in png.c and the "jpeg_load()" function in jpeg.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PNG or JPEG file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Gentoo discontinued support for SWFTools. We recommend that users
      unmerge swftools:

NOTE: Users could upgrade to ">=media-gfx/swftools-0.9.1", however
      these packages are not currently stable.
